alert.note: Alert for Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 2:27PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Norton, northern Decatur, Red Willow and northeastern Hitchcock Counties through 300 PM CDT... At 226 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles southeast of Culbertson to 7 miles south of Lebanon. Movement was northwest at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Culbertson around 230 PM CDT. Lebanon around 235 PM CDT. Danbury around 240 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include McCook. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
